text:
Merged my work from today with no conflicts- main has the updated code.  Registration works and redirects to individual profiles.
Miracle, Login has issues, also the pwHash is storing actual passwords in sql- this may be the issue with login.  I tried to add bcrypt to studentauthcontroller and tutorauthcontroller (approx lines 30 & 94 on both, and for this I added a config package/class), but the issue is not fixed.  The student and tutor login code is now in the login controller so there is only one link for both types of logins, also the added login repository is what sets the roles for students and tutors in the login table.  The registration controllers remained where they were/separate.
Vinitha, the subjects are added to the registration form but I can't get them to populate in the tables.  I tried via the authcontrollers where the new record is being created (line 94) but there kept being issues.  I need you to get the enum to populate in sql.
Tried to get the calendar to display on the tutor profile, working on that/filling in the rest of the profiles and the nav bars tomorrow.  Miracle there is a space for payment info on each of the profile templates, I couldn't remember which needed it, or maybe both do. LMK if you have any questions. Thx

text: Ok I changed my schedule around so I could look at the code this morning & i’m honestly ready to give up on this project. There are so many things not together & that were moved around in the code that I can’t even figure out whats wrong since its so much already pulled into main & its becoming overwhelming for me

text: the enum values from the registration form are not populating in sql- i need you to get them to populate there. I tried making the subjects class an entity, and tried passing them through the tutorauth controller and I can't get them into sql database.

text:
I know a lot has changed, a lot of the code you wrote is the same, with some things added to it or rearranged.  It took forever for me to get it to run- I didn't think it would ever work.  I had  a lot of long convos with chat gpt, and searching google, and rewatching class lecture/pdfs.
I don't know if the security config i added is necessary or not, i just noticed that the pwHash field in sql was displaying the actual password.  Maybe walking through the authentication pdfs/class lecture again could help?
I can try to help with this, its just hard when the code is completely separate until its merged.  I plan on working on this all day tomorrow and monday so if you want to meet at all, I'm available or if you are working and can't get to it I can try, just let me know.   I still don't feel like I fully understand it all but I think we will be able to make it work -eventually :face_with_spiral_eyes:
